translated: Verses of the Elders
The Group of Twenties
The First Chapter
Bhaddiya, the Son of Kāḷigodhā
I used to ride on the neck of an elephant,
wearing delicate clothes;
I ate rice with meat curry,🔽and drank fine wine.

analyzed: sojja bhaddo sātatikaḥ  uñchā pattā gate
translated: But now I am good Bhaddiya, the son of Kāḷigodhā,
delighting in the alms I receive,
meditating without clinging.
I wear rag-robes, am diligent,
delighting in the alms I receive,
meditating without clinging.
I eat only almsfood, am diligent,
I have only three robes, am diligent,
I go on continuous almsround, am diligent,

analyzed: eka āsanī sātatikaḥ  pe  patta piṇḍī sātatikaḥ
translated: I eat in one session, am diligent,
I eat what I get on almsround, am diligent,
I live in the forest, am diligent,
I live at the foot of a tree, am diligent,
I live out in the open, am diligent,
I live in a charnel ground, am diligent,
I live wherever I happen to be, am diligent,
I am a sitter, am diligent,
I am a person of few desires, am diligent,
I am content, am diligent,
He lived secluded, being energetic,
He lived unassociated, being energetic,
He lived with energy aroused, being energetic,

analyzed: pe  hitvā sata palam kasa  sovaṇṇam sata rājika
translated: …🔽Having abandoned a hundred-thousand-piece bronze gong,🔽And a golden throne with a hundred kings,
I took up a clay bowl,
This was my second anointing.
In a high jeweled palace,🔽With a strong watchtower and rampart,

analyzed: rakkhitaḥ khagga hatthehi  uttasam viharim pure
translated: Protected by sword-wielding guards,🔽I lived in fear in the city.
Now the good one is fearless,
Having given up fear and dread,
He meditates having gone to the forest,
The son of the good Goatherd.
Having been established in the aggregate of virtue,
Developing mindfulness and wisdom,
I gradually attained
The destruction of all the fetters.”
